Main
================================================================================

Alessandro Bramucci {#title}
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Hi! I am an economist with 5+ years of coding experience in R in different academic projects. I am passionate about R in particular for macroeconomic modelling and macroeconomic data analysis. 

Professional experience {data-icon=suitcase}
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

### Research associate

Berlin School of Economics and Law (HWR)

Berlin

October 2019 - August 2022

---

Project ["WIPOSIM - The economic policy online simulator"](https://www.alessandrobramucci.com/project/wiposim/). My tasks included:

::: concise
- Programming of the simulations in R and development of the interactive applications with *shiny*
- Writing of the didactic texts accompanying the simulations in particular on subject of fiscal policy
- Data work in R with the packages of the *R tidyverse*
- Publication of scientific articles in academic journals
- Acquisition of third-party funds
:::

### Research associate

Berlin School of Economics and Law (HWR)

Berlin

October 2017 - April 2019

---

Project ["Model-theoretic Foundations of Controversies in Economic Policy" (MGWK)](https://www.alessandrobramucci.com/project/mgwk/). My tasks included:

::: concise
- Programming of the simulations in R and development of the interactive applications with *shiny*
- Drafting of selected chapters of the online book [*Introduction to Macroeconomics: Pluralist and Interactive*](https://eng.mgwk.de/)
- Translation of the book and the simulations from German into English
- Presentation of the project in workshops and conferences
:::

```{js move_disclaim, echo=FALSE}
        pages = document.querySelectorAll('.pagedjs_page');

            timer += 200;
            return;
        }
        if(pages.length !== 1 && timer > 5000) return clearInterval(changeDC);
        var firstPage = pages[0];
        var lastePage = pages[pages.length - 1];
        var aside = firstPage.querySelector('#aside');
        var asideClone = aside.cloneNode();
        asideClone.id = "aside_last";
        var disclaim = document.querySelector('#disclaimer');
        asideClone.appendChild(disclaim);
        lastePage.querySelector('.pagedjs_page_content > div').appendChild(asideClone);
        clearInterval(changeDC);
    }, 200);
})()
```
